result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian J. Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Notice of right to seek post conviction relief

2:48 PM cases 22CF74 and 21CF226 called. Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Brian J. Johnson appeared in court, Attorney Christopher Wilhelm for Brian J. Johnson appeared in court. There is an agreement. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads No Contest to Amended Count 1 in 21CF226: Misdemeanor Retail Theft. Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 3: Theft- Movable Property <=$2,500. 
Court accepts pleas, finds the defendant Guilty and withholds sentencing. Anything else is dismissed and read in. Defendant makes a statement before sentencing. 
Defendant is placed on Probation on each count with conditions: 
No Contact with N.P. or Fleet Farm. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Provide a DNA sample. 
Pay DNA surcharge and court costs. 
On 21CF226 only: 5 days in Jail with Huber or 40 hours community service. Defendant intends to complete the community service. 
Anything else is dismissed and read in. No credit if revoked from Probation.

(10:32 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brian J. Johnson does not appear in court or via Zoom.
Clerk notes the defendant is also scheduled for court today at 3 pm for a plea hearing in Branch 3.
State requests this matter be rescheduled to be heard in Branch 3 at 3 pm for a plea hearing today.

10:28 AM Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Brian J. Johnson appeared in court without counsel. Defendant advised of right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea hearing on March 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to Sender
